page.title: 02170 ACRE FARM.
page.content: On one 170 acre farm we visited the farmer keeps 200 dairy cows, 120 beef cattle and 80 young stock. He has four full time helpers and he takes on a temporary worker each summer. Milking starts each morning at 6 a.m. and ends at 8.30 a.m. In the afternoon milking starts at 3.30 p.m. and finishes at 6 p.m. The milking parlour has 24 stalls. Twelve cows are milked at one time, while the other twelve cows are being washed and prepared. Each cow gives an average of 5,000 litres of milk a year. The tanker from the local creamery calls each morning. The outer fields are used for growing silage. Cutting started on the twelth of May. It will be cut every 6 weeks. The farmer is aiming for three cuts for his winter fodder.
